title: JavaScript localStorage
question: What is the purpose of the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript?
options: To store data that will be deleted when the browser is closed
To store data that persists even when the browser is closed
To store data that can only be accessed by a specific domain
To store data that can be accessed by any website
correctOption: To store data that persists even when the browser is closed

question: Unlike session storage, data stored in localStorage persists even after the browser is closed and reopened.
